page.title: 08Communications
page.content: Truro Railway Station provides an important link in the West Country Penzance to London line and is the connection point for the branch line to Falmouth. The A39, A3076, and A390 roads pass through Truro whilst the remainder of the roads are of minor classification. Truro has a Bus Station which is an important centre of the Cornish National Bus network. There is a River link from Truro,(once an important port), to Falmouth for pleasure trips, or occasional use by industry such as Channel Foods, a fish processing plant. The area also serves as a centre for British Telecom and sorting offices for the Post Office. Truro has the lowest bridging point over the Rivers Kenwyn and Allen which meet in the City, so this has long made it a focus for local roads and communications.
